dublin_core.dcvalue: Although modern communication technology is well developed telehematology does not readily lend itself to practical laboratory use Multicenter therapeutic protocols may offer preferential opportunities The cytologists of the AML 2001 protocol established an innovative organization to demonstrate the reliability of the diagnostic assessment of acute myeloid leukemia through a rapid and decentralized exchange of information via the internet and to define the conditions optimizing expert diagnosis Telediagnosis appears to be a powerful tool for cytological review and other issues
Telehematology: a pilot experience of cytological diagnosis of acute myeloid leukemia via the Internet. A GOELAMS study.
